values:
a lot of my friends are doing very grown-up things.
getting married. performing on broadway.

i still feel like a kid.
tune in to WMTS.org tonight at 11 o' clock/10 o' clock central. you won't be disappointed.

i spent last night getting drunk
with almost perfect strangers.

oh gladys, girl, i love you. but oh, get a life!!

nobody calls you back.
this town is dead to me.
come friday, i am so out of here.

jay and luke and i made a movie.

http://www.undergroundfilm.org/films/detail.tcl?wid=1020403

enjoy!!

308 S 4th Ave
Murfreesboro, TN 37130

send me things. i miss you.

so long, honey babe
where i'm bound, i can't tell
but goodbye is too good a word, babe
so i'll just say fare thee well

i ain't sayin' you treated me unkind
you could've done better, but i don't mind
you just kinda wasted my precious time
but don't think twice, it's all right.


tonight will be my last night in town.

no more no more. 12 days and i am a ghost.

but i feel like one already.

if you are coming tonight, try and carpool. there wont be a ton of places to park.

see you tonight!

this is it, guys. the big one. the big party. its tomorrow. its at my house.

3247 custer lake dr.
marietta, ga 30064

come one. come all.

you are invited.

on the eve of monday, the 1st of august, ms. jennifer and i will be hosting a classy party at ms. jennifer's estate.
if you wish to attend, you may. but there are two rules:
rule 1. you must dress your best, like you did for prom or that wedding you went to.
rule 2. you must be awesome or have an awesome air about you.
jennifer and i will be happy to answer any questions you have regarding directions, god, political ethos, anything.
feel free to call 404.234.0912
thank you.

katie: mtsu is the only university in the world that has a concrete industry management program.

me: you know, concrete is really underrated. most of us just take it for granite.

mom: youre such a blockhead.
if anybody wants to go with me, sonny, and maria we will have an extra seat in the car.

john hus, bohemian religious reformer, burned at the stake, 1415.
saint thomas more, beheaded, 1535.
first state convention of the u.s. republican party, 1854.

i dont know what the fuck im doing anymore. but i will be gone in a little over a month. so you better make your move soon. whatever it is.

if you see me over summer from now on, chances are i will have a video camera in my hand. do not be alarmed. i am making a documentary with a couple friends of mine. if you have a camera and dont mind spending a few dollars on tape, you should partake in it with us.

i had this idea like 20 minutes ago, and jay and nolan are already on board. just record everything you can in 16:9 wide. record as much as you can for as long as you can. just be sure to touch base with me somehow before summers out so that i can get all your tape and start editing it.

i think this could be really cool.

last night was really awesome.
but i woke up feeling like shit, and i still do.
i know why, and its no surprise.
this is the part of the cycle that i like the least.
but thats how it goes.
around
and around and
around and
around
and around
and around and
around and
around.

the world is currently in a green mood.
whatever that means.

ps. sigur ros is playing in atlanta on september 6. im there. are you with me?

it sucks when you sleep till four and realize that you could keep sleeping and it wont make a damn bit of difference to anybody.

but as i write that tim patrick calls and tells me that he enjoyed listening to one of my songs. so i guess all hope isnt lost.

think ima go gay now because girls are fucking mean little heartbreakers.







                what!

im about to leave for jekyll island. gone till tuesday or so.

everythings shaping up nicely.
the new bands off to a nice start.
i graduated.
intend to start making short films when i return.
enjoying everybodys company while i still can.

i was asked this last night but was too drunk to think up an answer:
what is love to you?
well, i'll tell ya...
i love you, and thats all you need to know.

first night ive gotten to bed at a decent hour since thursday.

my bellys full of food, my hearts full of love, and my heads full of good thoughts.

i got coffee with ruti tonight. it was the first time id seen her in months and months, but we picked up like wed never spent a day apart, like we always do. i figure thats when you know youre really good friends with somebody because the same thing happens with me and cary or me and shauna. however long we go without communication, we are always able to resuscitate the old friendship like it was nothing or like nothing ever happened.

its thoughts like these that make it easier to see these people off and to go off myself. i know that whatever we decide to do with our lives, i will always be around for them, and theyll always have some time for me.
and so ends one of the craziest weekends of my life.

i just figured out what the meaning of life is:

avoid death, or rather, rebel against it.

the weekend has been shaping up nicely.

i had dinner with alex, annie, and jordan last night. then alex and i saw the animation show (which i highly recommend). there was this one short titled "hello," and id really like to get the character from it tattooed somewhere on my body. we met up with chase afterwards at fellinis and hung out with this girl, ginna, who works there. got free pizza. always a good thing.

today i slept in and played some frisbee, shot the breeze, and then hung out with cary. we drove around for a while and ended up at chases. left there and went to waffle house where we met luke. talked for a couple hours then came home. pretty low-key, but sometimes its better that way.

i dont think ive made a post thats catalogued my day in a very long time. weird. im in a weird mood i guess.

anyway, if i havent given you a copy of my demo yet, and you want to contribute something to the final recording of it, let me know somehow and i will burn you a copy of it.

hope all is well.
my mac is kicking some serious ass right now. i just put the itunes on shuffle and the thing knows exactly what i want to hear. its mysterious and wonderful.

i figured out music!
im going to do everything!

the ben folds adventure was almost over before it started, but we pulled it together at the last minute. the whole trip was enjoyable: the 7 hour drive up, the meeting the kids at ccm, the going to that girls birthday dinner about an hour after i met her, the ben folds show*, the driving back to the dorms, the hanging out all night with complete strangers and enjoying myself, the breakfast in the morning, and the drive back. not one regret. this might be an early closing to the month-long birthday celebration i had in mind, but thats ok.

i thought as i was driving home, a glimpse of something beautiful is much better than staring at it until it is ugly. that made some things a lot easier.

*seriously one of the best shows ive ever been to. audience participation. dr dre cover. goddam genius, that ben folds.

but on the bright side, im going to see ben folds with cary and patrick this weekend at some college in cincinnati.

BEN FOLDS!

CARY!

CINCINNATI!

ROAD TRIP WITH THE BOYS!

ive been waiting some three years to see ben folds and its finally going down. with my best friend.

GODDAM IM EXCITED!

i went to a b-boy battle last saturday.
i got an apple powerbook today.

break-dancing rules.
macs rule.

ps. there is a beta version of soulseex out now (soulseek client for macs). it rules too.
i got accepted to oglethorpe. go school!
contact me if you are interested in putting together a halo 2 party. because i now own it. bitch.
the monologues last show will take place tomorrow at the vineyard. itll start around seven or seven thirty. you probably dont give a damn, though.
i leave through a hole in the wall.

alright. this friday we are playing at the vineyard. its here comes the metric systems cd release show. along with them, we will be playing with james abercrombies dance buffet, fate heroic, and saila. but thats not all. another band has been added to the bill. sort of a last minute surprise. rockford will be reuniting, if only for one show. speculation said it couldnt be done, but we threw this in her face.

in brief:
friday.
vineyard.
doors at 7:00 pm.
show at 8:00 pm.
here comes the metric system.
rockford.
the monologue.
dance buffet.
fate heroic.
saila.
please come.

i tipped it,
and kissed the prettiest angel
on the cheek.

thanks to those who came to the show last night. it went very well. very very well.

so im kinda out-of-sorts tonight. if you give a damn, you know where to find me. although i kinda just want to be alone and write my songs, itd be nice to see a friendly face.

even though it may rain tonight, the show is still on.

my house.
7:00 pm.

3247 custer lake drive
marietta, ga 30064

from dallas highway:
get on BARRET PARKWAY like youre going to the mall. take a LEFT at the red light that intersects BURNT HICKORY RD. drive for a few minutes till you come up to the entrance of my neighborhood, BURNT HICKORY HILLS, on your right (street name: CUPELO DR). enter. drive down some twists in the road (note: at the first twist, cupelo dr turns into custer lake dr). my house will be on the left. its green with trees and and a brick mailbox in the front. balloons or something will be tied up.

from 41:
say you come from the mall. take a right onto 41. drive until you get to the red light intersection with KENNESAW DUE WEST RD. take a left. after you go straight through the stilesboro intersection, take a left onto GORDON COMBS RD. drive until that road dead ends into a stop sign. take a right onto BURNT HICKORY RD. drive for about a mile (probably less) till you come up to the entrance of my neighborhood, BURNT HICKORY HILLS, on your right (street name: CUPELO DR). enter. drive down some twists in the road (note: at the first twist, cupelo dr turns into custer lake dr). my house will be on the left. its green with trees and and a brick mailbox in the front. balloons or something will be tied up.

try to carpool, please. i dont know how many people are coming, but if its a lot, itll be difficult to get everybody parked.

if it does rain, we will do the show inside. itll be more intimate and relaxed.

any questions or anything, dont hesitate to call me: 404-234-0912.

hope to see you tonight.

(take me down)
sweet water wont you take me down
(take me down)
sweet water wont you take me down
cos ive been feelin sentimental bout the little bit of time ive got left
sweet water wont you take me down?

(take me down)
sweet water wont you take me down
(take me down)
sweet water wont you take me down
oh take me down into the river where the spirit rinses sins from my head
sweet water wont you take me down?

(take me down)
cold water wont you take me down
(take me down)
cold water wont you take me down
cos ive been feelin pretty guilty bout the wilting flower left on my grave
cold water wont you take me down?

(take me down)
cold water wont you take me down
(take me down)
cold water wont you take me down
oh take me down beyond the river where we never spect our souls to be saved
cold water wont you take me down?

because my bodys just a vessel thatll end up crashing with all these waves
(cold water wont you take me down)
and itll dull and fold and mold into a whole with earth and birth a new day
(cold water wont you take me down)
but the kingdoms like a ring of perfect things and itd bore me to stay
(cold water wont you take me down)
to stay
(cold water wont you take me down)
oh take me away.
this guy. this guy right here.

(so the lights go out and he saunters onto the stage with his four-piece band. in the darkness, its hard to make out the whos-who but five apparent musicians seem to be walking in and out of strips of light. they take their positions. the lights come on. the show begins. bob stood behind an electric piano the whole night, which was kind of disappointing, but hes bob dylan. he will do whatever the hell he wants. his voice seemed a bit hoarse. maybe all those cigarettes and years have finally caught up to him. now, the voice, although a bit rough, shot me down into my very soul. to hear that voice and feel that presence will never be matched. a modest show. a fantastic show. they played for nearly two hours then came back for a three song encore. its all over now, baby blue. you go your way and ill go mine. it aint dark yet, but its gettin there (not sure if thats the title, but the song was a highlight of the evening). like a rolling stone. all along the watchtower... just to list a few. he finished and approached the microphone. now, dylan rarely speaks to the audience (from what ive heard). so seeing this sent chills up and down my spine. he mumbled "alright..." and the crowd, of course, went wild. he spoke a bit more, but no matter how hard i tried to pick up on what he was saying, the roar of the audience just drowned out his voice even more. but he finished introducing the band and said his good night by standing in the center of the stage, instrumentless, statuesque, black suit with red trim, black cowboy hat with the sides flipped up. we erupted. he walked off stage. we went home, enlightened.)
open your parachute and grab your gun.

wet your lips and kiss his skin.
whet your teeth and sink them in.

on april 30th pygmy will be coming to town to play a show with the monologue (and possibly others, yet to be confirmed). its my job to find a place. no swayzes. we want a house show. so if you have any suggestions, let me know.

e-mail: sterileshowers@hotmail.com
cell phone: 404-234-0912
screen name: leftyputnam
or just leave a comment. whichever.

thank you.
